assignments.description: Assign the new Labour Values entered by the user on the previous screens to the record variable prior updating the Service Appointment
assignments.name: Assign_LabourValues_to_ServiceAppointment
assignments.label: Assign New Labour Values to Service Appointment

assignments.description: This element assigns the values of the fields "Start Date" and "Completed Date" from the user entry on the previous screen to the Work Order Variable in order to update it in the subsequent step.
assignments.name: Assign_New_StartEndDate_to_WorkOrder
assignments.label: Assign new Start/End Date to Work Order

assignments.description: This Assign Element is used to show a "Path" component on each Screen element that shows the user the current step they are at in the whole process to add a new part.
assignments.name: Assign_Stage_Labor
assignments.label: Assign Stage "Review Labor"

assignments.description: This Assign Element is used to show a "Path" component on each Screen element that shows the user the current step they are at in the whole process to add a new part.
assignments.name: Assign_Stage_Observations
assignments.label: Assign Stage "Observations"

assignments.description: This Assign Element is used to show a "Path" component on each Screen element that shows the user the current step they are at in the whole process to add a new part.
assignments.name: Assign_Stage_Summary
assignments.label: Assign Stage "Summary"

assignments.description: This Assign Element is used to show a "Path" component on each Screen element that shows the user the current step they are at in the whole process to add a new part.
assignments.name: Assign_StageJobNotes
assignments.label: Assign Stage "Job Notes"

assignments.description: This Assign Element is used to show a "Path" component on each Screen element that shows the user the current step they are at in the whole process to add a new part.
assignments.name: Assign_StageParts
assignments.label: Assign Stage "Review Parts"

assignments.description: This will assign the numeric count value for the element "Get all Work Order Line Items" to the variable "var_WorkOrderLineItemCount", which will be used later in the flow e.g. on the screen "Review Labour" for the preview of Labour Lines to be created (and split across WOLIs)
assignments.name: Assign_WOLI_Count
assignments.label: Count WOLIs and assign to Variable

choices.description: Used as choice options on radio buttons in screen elements.
choices.name: Choice_AddAdditionalAsset

choices.description: Used as choice options on radio buttons in screen elements.
choices.name: Choice_AddAdjustScheduleItems

choices.description: Used as choice options on radio buttons in screen elements.
choices.name: Choice_AddJobNotes

choices.description: Used as choice options on radio buttons in screen elements.
choices.name: Choice_AddOrAdjustParts

choices.description: Used as choice options on radio buttons in screen elements.
choices.name: Choice_AddScheduleItems

choices.description: Used as choice options on radio buttons in screen elements.
choices.name: Choice_AdjustServiceAppointment

choices.description: Used as choice options on radio buttons in screen elements.
choices.name: Choice_FinishWorkCompleteReview
choices.choiceText: I'm all done - finish Work Complete Review

choices.description: Used as choice options on radio buttons in screen elements.
choices.name: Choice_GoBackToOverview

choices.description: Used as choice options on radio buttons in screen elements.
choices.name: Choice_GotoNextReviewItem
choices.choiceText: Looking good - go to the next review item

choices.description: Used as choice options on radio buttons in screen elements.
choices.name: Choice_StartOver
choices.choiceText: Start Over / Review Again

choices.description: Used as choice options on radio buttons in screen elements.
choices.name: Choice_UpdateObservationWorkSteps

choices.description: Used as choice options on radio buttons in screen elements.
choices.name: Choice_UpdateSICWorkSteps

decisions.description: This decision is used to determine the user's choice on the previous screen on the radio buttons - and depending on the choice either go to the "Create Job Notes" dialog or go on to the next screen.
decisions.name: Decision_AddJobNote
decisions.label: Add Job Note?

decisions.description: This decision is used to determine the user's choice on the previous screen on the radio buttons - and depending on the choice either execute a sub-flow to add or amend parts or go on to the next screen.
decisions.name: Decision_AddOrAdjustParts
decisions.label: Add or adjust parts?

decisions.description: This decision is used to determine the user's choice on the previous screen on the radio buttons - and depending on the choice either execute sub-flows to add WOLIs or add or amend Schedule Items or go on to the next screen.
decisions.name: Decision_AddWorkItems
decisions.label: Add Work Items

decisions.description: This decision is used to determine the user's choice on the previous screen on the radio buttons - and depending on the choice either open a subsequent screen to amend the selected Service Appointment or go on to the final Work Complete Review confirmation screen.
decisions.name: Decision_AdjustLaborOnSA
decisions.label: Adjust Labour on Service Appointment?
decisions.defaultConnectorLabel: Go to Work Complete Review Checkout

decisions.description: This decision is used to determine the user's choice on the previous screen on the radio buttons - and depending on the choice either execute a sub-flow to amend the selected SIC or go on to the next screen.
decisions.name: Decision_AdjustScheduleItemCode
decisions.label: Adjust Schedule Item Code?

decisions.description: This Element is used as a validation to prevent users to open this feature prematurely when the Work Order is still in an "in progress" state (= Service Appointments still open) or Work Order already in a "Closed" state. (=Status completed or cannot complete/cancel)
decisions.name: Decision_Check_WorkOrder_Status
decisions.label: Check Work Order Status

decisions.description: This decision is used to determine the user's choice on the previous screen on the radio buttons - and depending on the choice either go back to the start of the screen and start the review process over or finalise the flow and update the Status of the Work Order triggering this flow to "Reviewed"
decisions.name: Decision_FinishWorkCompleteReview
decisions.label: Finish Work Complete Review?

decisions.description: This decision element is used to determine whether the Work Order triggering this flow is a "Parent Work Order" or a "Child Work Order" - and depending on the outcome this will then show different "Summary" Screens (e.g. because Child WOs do not have WOLIs).
decisions.name: Decision_SummaryScreen_ParentWO_or_ChildWO
decisions.label: Parent WO or Child WO?

decisions.description: This decision is used to determine the user's choice on the previous screen on the radio buttons - and depending on the choice either execute a sub-flow to update the selected Work Step record or go to the next review item.
decisions.name: Decision_UpdateObservationWorkStep
decisions.label: Update Observation Work Step?

decisions.description: This is used as a validation prior to completing this flow in case Work Steps (SPOTS or SIC) exist that are still in an "open" state or do not have a SIC Code selected.
decisions.name: Decision_Validation_Open_WorkSteps_exist
decisions.label: Validation - Open Work Steps exist?

decisions.description: This is used as a validation prior to completing this flow in case the Work Order triggering this flow has blank "Start Date" or "End Date" fields. The fields need to be populated in order to successfully send them to EAM via the integration.
decisions.name: Decision_Validation_WorkOrder_StartEndDateBlank
decisions.label: Work Order has blank Start/End Date"
decisions.defaultConnectorLabel: Start or End Date is populated

rules.name: Outcome_StartEndDate_Isblank
rules.label: Start or End Date is blank

decisions.description: This decision is used as a validation to prevent users from openening the Subflow "complete all open work steps" without having selected a Schedule Item from the datatable on the previous screen.
decisions.name: Decision_Validaton_NoScheduleItemSelected
decisions.label: No Schedule Item Selected?

decisions.description: This decision element is used to differentiate between "Parent Work Orders" and "Child Work Orders". This is required as Child Work Orders are NOT supposed to have WOLIs or further "grand child work orders" underneath. Accordingly, the user is not supposed to add additional WOLIs or Ancillary Work Orders underneath a child.
decisions.name: Decision_WorkOrder_IsParentOrChild
decisions.label: Work Order is Parent or Child?

Flow.description:
29/01/2023 - v1: Initial Version
02/02/2023 - v2: Add logic and screen to amend labor/actual times on a selected Service Appointment.
02/02/2023 - v3: Add Update elements to set the "Status" on Work Order triggering this flow to "Reviewed" in order to trigger other automation that will e.g. create Labour Lines (= Product Consumed records of the type "Labour Product")
03/02/2023 - v4: Add new Overview page with functionality to see all related WOLIs, SIC Codes, and Ancillary CWOs on the entry page incl. functionality to Add Assets and Add additional Schedule item codes from the radio button selection on the screen. Added a new screen to see all Job Notes related to the Work Order triggering this flow incl. the feature to add new Job Notes records.
03/02/2023 - v5: Add new "Summary" screen including summary data tables to preview total labour time.
05/02/2023 - v6: Add Assigned Resource Datatable to the "Review Labour" screen in order to let users see a preview of what Labour Lines will be created after the flow is finished. Add logic to identify and handle use-case when a user opens this flow from a Child Work Order that is not supposed to have WOLIs or grandchild work orders.
06/02/2023 - v7: First release candidate opened from a quick action button.
12/02/2023 - v8: Remove second description line from Header element; Add fault lines and Error Screens for all Update/Create elements; Add Validation for "Work Order must have Start/End Date" and "Open Work Steps exist" prior to the final summary screen. Show the column "Service Territory" in the Review Labour Data Table.
12/02/2023 - v9: Changed validation for Unanswered Schedule Item Codes/Observations after experiencing problems in testing (Flow also found Observations with blank SIC Codes)
13/02/2023 - v10: Copytext changes on screen elements (e.g. Review Labour screen); Add new Decision Element before the final "Summary Screen" and a new additional Summary Screen for "Child Work Orders" with logic to show Labour lines dynamically when Work Order is assigned to the METRO Service Territory
13/02/2023 - v11: Bugfix for the screen "Confirm Labour Adjustments" as the value for "New Travel Start Time" was not showing.
16/02/2023 - v12: Updated Error Screen "Cannot Update Work Order" with new error reason bullet point; Update the "Finish" button on the last "Summary" screen element to read "Finish" instead of "Next" as requested by QA testing.
16/02/2023 - V13: Removed the "Select WOLI" datatable in the Create New Job Note screen and create elements as requested by QA testing. Reason: all job notes should go against the Parent WO consistently, so that EAM/IPS users can see the full history of the notes in one place.

formulas.description: This formula is used to calculate the new labor time (minutes) and present it back to the user on a screen after adjustments have been made on a selected Service Appointment.
formulas.name: fx_NewCalculatedLaborTime

formulas.description: This formula is used to calculate the new travel time (minutes) and present it back to the user on a screen after adjustments have been made to a selected Service Appointment.
formulas.name: fx_NewCalculatedTravelTime

Flow.interviewLabel: MSN - Work Order - Work Complete Review - Screenflow {!$Flow.CurrentDateTime}
Flow.label: MSN - Work Order - Work Completed Review - Screenflow

recordCreates.description: Create a new Job Note record from the record variable populated in the previous step.
recordCreates.name: Create_JobNote
recordCreates.label: Create new Job Note

recordLookups.description: Get all "Assigned Resource" records that are related to the Service Appointments under the Work Order triggering this flow. This will then be used to show a list of all resources in a data table on the following screen.
recordLookups.name: Get_all_AssignedResources_LabourReview
recordLookups.label: Get all Assigned Resources

recordLookups.description: Attempt to retrieve all Work Orders that are related to the Work Order triggering this flow. This will be used to show a list of all CWOs to the user on the next screen element. In case the variable is null, then the data table element on the next screen will not show rows accordingly.
recordLookups.name: Get_all_ChildWorkOrders
recordLookups.label: Get all Child Work Orders

recordLookups.description: Get all "Products Consumed" records that are related to the Work Order triggering this flow. This will be used to show a list of already consumed parts to the user on the next screen element.
recordLookups.name: Get_all_Consumed_Products
recordLookups.label: Get all Consumed Products

recordLookups.description: Get all "Job Notes" records that are related to the Work Order triggering this flow and its WOLIs/Service Appointments. This will be used to show a list of Job Notes to the user on the next screen element.
recordLookups.name: Get_all_JobNotes
recordLookups.label: Get all Job Notes

recordLookups.description: This element is used to look up all "Work Step" records related to the triggering Work Order or its related Work Order Line Items. This is then used to show the list of looked-up work steps in the screen "Review Observations".
recordLookups.name: Get_all_Observation_Work_Steps
recordLookups.label: Get all Observation Work Steps

recordLookups.description: This element is used to look up all "Work Step" records of the type "Schedule Item Code" related to the triggering Work Order or its related Work Order Line Items. This is then used to show the list of looked-up work steps in the screen "Review Schedule Item Codes".
recordLookups.name: Get_all_ScheduleItem_WorkSteps_Overview
recordLookups.label: Get all Schedule Item Work Steps

recordLookups.description: This element is used to look up all "Service Appointments" related to the triggering Work Order. This is then used to show the list of looked-up Service Appointments in the screen "Review Labour" so that the Job Coordinator can assess the actually booked labor times (=Actual Travel Start/Onsite Time/End times).
recordLookups.name: Get_all_Service_Appointments
recordLookups.label: Get all Service Appointments

recordLookups.description: This element is used to look up all "Work Step" records of the type "Schedule Item Code" related to the triggering Work Order or its related Work Order Line Items. This is then used to show the list of looked-up work steps in the screen "Review Schedule Item Codes".
recordLookups.name: Get_all_SIC_WorkSteps
recordLookups.label: Get all Schedule Item Work Steps

recordLookups.description: Attempt to retrieve all Work Order Line Items that are related to the Work Order triggering this flow. This will be used to show a list of all WOLIs to the user on the next screen element. This is required as all parts, labor, schedule items etc. always have to be related to a Child Work Order in EAM and are NOT supposed to go against the Parent Work Order. Only if the variable is blank (=no WOLIs exist) the triggering record usually is a Child Work Order and parts, costs, and labour can be added directly against the Work Order itself.
recordLookups.name: Get_all_WorkOrderLineItems
recordLookups.label: Get all Child Work Order Line Items

recordLookups.description: Retrieve record details from the Work Order that was triggering the flow. This will be used in subsequent steps to populate information in Screen elements.
recordLookups.name: Get_Current_WorkOrder_Details
recordLookups.label: Get Current Work Order Details

recordLookups.description: This element is used as a validation to look up all "Work Step" records (Observations AND SIC codes) related to the triggering Work Order or its related Work Order Line Items that are still in status "Open" or do not have a "Work Step Answer" filled in. The user will then be guided to an error screen that prompts them to fill the work steps out prior to finalizing the "Work Completed Review"
recordLookups.name: Get_Open_Unanswered_Work_Steps
recordLookups.label: Validation - Get open or unanswered Work Steps

recordUpdates.description: Used to apply the changes made by the user on the previous screen element to the "actual time" values on the selected Service Appointment.
recordUpdates.name: Update_Labour_on_ServiceAppointment
recordUpdates.label: Update Labour on Service Appointment

recordUpdates.description: Update the Work Order triggering this flow with new "Start Date" and "Completed Date" values as assigned in the previous element.
recordUpdates.name: Update_Work_Order_Start_End_Dates
recordUpdates.label: Update Work Order with new Start/End Date

recordUpdates.description: This element updates the "Status" of the Work Order triggering this flow to "Reviewed" in order to trigger other automation that then creates e.g. Labour Lines (=Products Consumed records of the type "Labour Product") against the Work Order.
recordUpdates.name: Update_WorkOrder_Status_to_Reviewed
recordUpdates.label: Update Work Order Status to "Reviewed"

screens.description: This screen is used to let the user create additional Job Notes against the Work Order.
screens.name: Screen_AddJobNote
screens.label: Add Job Note

fields.name: Screen_AddJobNote_InfoText
fields.fieldText: Important note: Job Notes are immediately sent to EAM after creation and any changes/updates made later will not be reflected in EAM.

fields.name: Screen_AddJobNote_NoteDetails_Subheading
fields.fieldText: Please enter the Job Note details

fields.name: Screen_AddJobNote_NoteDetails
fields.fieldText: Note Details

screens.description: This screen is used to let the user adjust the selected Service Appointment from the previous screen and make adjustments
screens.name: Screen_AdjustSelectedSA
screens.label: Adjust Labour on Service Appointment

screens.description: This screen is used as a confirmation page prior to updating the selected Service Appointment record with the new actual times values entered on the previous screen.
screens.name: Screen_ConfirmSALabourAdjustments
screens.label: Confirm Labour Adjustments

fields.name: Screen_ConfirmSALabourAdjustments_Subheading
fields.fieldText: 1. Please review and confirm the following changes to {!Screen_ReviewLabour_ServiceAppointmentDataTable.firstSelectedRow.AppointmentNumber}.

fields.name: Screen_ConfirmSALabourAdjustments_OldLabourValues_TravelTimeMinutes

fields.fieldText: Current labor time (minutes): {!Screen_ReviewLabour_ServiceAppointmentDataTable.firstSelectedRow.MSN_Labour_Time_Minutes__c}

fields.fieldText: New Values

fields.name: Screen_ConfirmSALabourAdjustments_NewLabourValues_TravelStart
fields.fieldText: New Travel Start: {!Screen_AdjustSelectedSA_TravelStart}

fields.name: Screen_ConfirmSALabourAdjustments_NewLabourValues_ActualStartOnsite

fields.name: Screen_ConfirmSALabourAdjustments_NewLabourValues_ActualEnd

fields.fieldText: New travel time (minutes): {!fx_NewCalculatedTravelTime}

fields.name: Screen_ConfirmSALabourAdjustments_NewLabourValues_LaborTimeMinutes
fields.fieldText: New labor time (minutes): {!fx_NewCalculatedLaborTime}

screens.description: This Screen shows a data table to the user to give them an overview what Job Notes have been entered so far.
screens.name: Screen_JobNotes
screens.label: Job Notes Overview

fields.name: Screen_JobNotes_NotesDataTable_Heading
fields.fieldText: 1. The following Notes have been entered on this job

fields.name: Screen_JobNotes_ActionRadiobuttons_Heading
fields.fieldText: 2. What would you like to do?

fields.name: Screen_JobNotes_ActionRadiobuttons_Infotext
fields.fieldText: Please note: Notes are sent to EAM immediately after they have been entered and updates to a Note in Salesforce will not be reflected in EAM.

fields.name: Screen_JobNotes_ActionRadiobuttons
fields.fieldText: Please select an action

screens.description: This screen is used as an error screen in case the system was not able to create new Job Notes against the Work Order.
screens.name: Screen_JobNotes_Create_Error
screens.label: Create Job Note - Error

value.stringValue: Error: Cannot create a new job note

fields.name: Screen_JobNotes_Create_Error_ErrorSubheading
fields.fieldText: Awww, snap! I could not create a new Job Note for your Work Order {!Get_Current_WorkOrder_Details.WorkOrderNumber}.

fields.name: Screen_JobNotes_Create_Error_ErrorDetails
fields.fieldText:
Unfortunately, the flow could not create a new Job Note record for you. If you see this screen, it might be that:


  • You don't have the required access rights to create new Job Note records related to the Work Order

Please get in touch with your friendly MSN Salesforce Support Team and inform them about this error.


You can close this dialogue now.

screens.description: This screen shows an error if the User has not selected a Schedule Item from the datatable in the previous screen.
screens.name: Screen_NoScheduleItemSelected_Error
screens.label: No Schedule Item Selected - Error

fields.name: Screen_NoScheduleItemSelected_Error_Heading
fields.fieldText: Awww, snap! You haven't selected a Schedule Item in the table on the previous screen.

fields.name: Screen_NoScheduleItemSelected_Error_Details
fields.fieldText: It looks like you haven't selected a schedule item from the table on the previous screen. Please go back and select one before retrying.

screens.nextOrFinishButtonLabel: Go back to the previous screen

screens.description: This Screen shows a data table to the user to give them an overview what parts already have been consumed on the job and gives them the choice to either add or amend parts.
screens.name: Screen_PartsUsedOverview
screens.label: Used Parts Overview

fields.name: Screen_PartsUsedOverview_ProductsConsumedDataTable_Heading
fields.fieldText: 1. The following parts have been used on this job

value.stringValue: [{"apiName":"ProductName","guid":"column-35d4","editable":false,"hasCustomHeaderLabel":false,"customHeaderLabel":"","wrapText":true,"order":0,"label":"Product Name","type":"text"},{"apiName":"QuantityConsumed","guid":"column-59af","editable":false,"hasCustomHeaderLabel":false,"customHeaderLabel":"","wrapText":true,"order":1,"label":"Quantity Consumed","type":"number"},{"apiName":"MSN_Consumed_From_Location__c","guid":"column-dca1","editable":false,"hasCustomHeaderLabel":false,"customHeaderLabel":"","wrapText":true,"order":2,"label":"Consumed from","type":"customRichText"},{"apiName":"MSN_WorkOrder_Number__c","guid":"column-b71e","editable":false,"hasCustomHeaderLabel":true,"customHeaderLabel":"Related to","wrapText":true,"order":3,"label":"Work Order Number","type":"customRichText"},{"apiName":"MSN_WorkType_Name__c","guid":"column-2d82","editable":false,"hasCustomHeaderLabel":true,"customHeaderLabel":"Work Type","wrapText":true,"order":4,"label":"Work Type Name","type":"customRichText"},{"apiName":"Not_Sufficient_EAM_Stock__c","guid":"column-5c78","editable":false,"hasCustomHeaderLabel":true,"customHeaderLabel":"EAM Stock Insufficient? ","wrapText":true,"order":5,"label":"Not Sufficient EAM Stock","type":"boolean"}]

fields.name: Screen_PartsUsedOverview_ActionRadiobuttons_Heading
fields.fieldText: 2. What would you like to do?

fields.name: Screen_PartsUsedOverview_ActionRadiobuttons_Infotext
fields.fieldText: Please note: if you want to update a specific part, please select one from the list above first and then choose the radio button option "Add or adjust parts" and hit next.

fields.name: Screen_PartsUsedOverview_ActionRadiobuttons
fields.fieldText: Please select an action

screens.description: This screen is used to show all Service Appointments and the recorded "actual times" to the user in order to give them the opportunity to review accrued labour times on all Service Appointments related to the Work Order Triggering this Appointment.
screens.name: Screen_ReviewLabour
screens.label: Review Labour

fields.name: Screen_ReviewLabour_ServiceAppointmentDataTable_Subheading
fields.fieldText: 1. Please review the recorded actual times on each Service Appointment

value.stringValue: [{"apiName":"AppointmentNumber","guid":"column-03a6","editable":false,"hasCustomHeaderLabel":true,"customHeaderLabel":"SA Number","wrapText":true,"order":0,"label":"Appointment Number","type":"text"},{"apiName":"MSN_AssignedServiceResource_Name__c","guid":"column-dd84","editable":false,"hasCustomHeaderLabel":true,"customHeaderLabel":"Field Crew","wrapText":true,"order":1,"label":"Assigned Service Resource - Name","type":"customRichText"},{"apiName":"MSN_ServiceTerritory_Name__c","guid":"column-004c","editable":false,"hasCustomHeaderLabel":true,"customHeaderLabel":"Service Territory","wrapText":true,"order":2,"label":"Service Territory - Name","type":"customRichText"},{"apiName":"MSN_Actual_Travel_Time_Minutes__c","guid":"column-fc2a","editable":false,"hasCustomHeaderLabel":true,"customHeaderLabel":"Travel (min)","wrapText":true,"order":3,"label":"Actual Travel Time (Minutes)","type":"number"},{"apiName":"MSN_Labour_Time_Minutes__c","guid":"column-53bc","editable":false,"hasCustomHeaderLabel":true,"customHeaderLabel":"Labour (min)","wrapText":true,"order":4,"label":"Labour Time (Minutes)","type":"number"},{"apiName":"MSN_TravelStart__c","guid":"column-88c7","editable":false,"hasCustomHeaderLabel":false,"customHeaderLabel":"","wrapText":true,"order":5,"label":"Travel Start","type":"customDateTime"},{"apiName":"ActualStartTime","guid":"column-09ef","editable":false,"hasCustomHeaderLabel":true,"customHeaderLabel":"Actual Start Onsite","wrapText":true,"order":6,"label":"Actual Start","type":"customDateTime"},{"apiName":"ActualEndTime","guid":"column-a8c9","editable":false,"hasCustomHeaderLabel":false,"customHeaderLabel":"","wrapText":true,"order":7,"label":"Actual End","type":"customDateTime"}]

fields.name: Screen_ReviewLabour_AssignedResourceDataTable_Subheading
fields.fieldText: Preview: when you finish this process, it will create Labour Lines for the following field crew

fields.name: Screen_ReviewLabour_AssignedResourceDataTable_InfoText
fields.fieldText: Important notes: This work order has {!var_WorkOrderLineItemCount} Work Order Line Items. Labour Lines will be split equally across all WOLIs e.g. 1 Service Appointment, 2 WOLIs, and 2 assigned field crew will generate 4 Labour Lines.

fields.name: Screen_ReviewLabour_ActionSubheading
fields.fieldText: 2. What would you like to do?

fields.name: Screen_ReviewLabour_ActionInfotext
fields.fieldText: Please note: if you want to adjust actual times, please select a Service Appointment from the first list above first and then choose the radio button option "Update the selected Service Appointment" and hit next.

fields.name: Screen_ReviewLabour_ActionRadiobuttons
fields.fieldText: Please select an action

screens.description: This screen is used to prompt the user to review all Observations (aka Work Steps or SPOTs) related to the parent Work Order and answered by the crew.
screens.name: Screen_ReviewObservations
screens.label: Review Observations (SPOTs)

fields.name: Screen_ReviewObservations_WorkStepsDataTable_Heading
fields.fieldText: 1. Please review the answers given for the following Observations:

fields.name: Screen_ReviewObservations_ActionRadiobuttons_Heading
fields.fieldText: 2. What would you like to do?

fields.name: Screen_ReviewObservations_ActionRadiobuttons_Infotext
fields.fieldText: Please note: if you want to update a specific Work Step, please select one from the list above first and then choose the radio button option "Update the selected Observation" and hit next.

fields.name: Screen_ReviewObservations_Actions_Radiobuttons
fields.fieldText: Please select an action

screens.description: This screen is used to prompt the user to review all Work Steps of the Type "Schedule Item Code" related to the parent Work Order and answered by the crew.
screens.name: Screen_ReviewSIC
screens.label: Review Schedule Item Codes (SIC)

fields.name: Screen_ReviewSIC_WorkStepsDataTable_Heading
fields.fieldText: 1. Please review the Schedule Item:

value.stringValue: [{"apiName":"MSN_WorkStep_Answer__c","guid":"column-9377","editable":false,"hasCustomHeaderLabel":true,"customHeaderLabel":"SIC Description","wrapText":true,"order":0,"label":"Work Step Answer","type":"text"},{"apiName":"MSN_ScheduleItem_Code__c","guid":"column-adf3","editable":false,"hasCustomHeaderLabel":true,"customHeaderLabel":"SIC","wrapText":true,"order":1,"label":"Schedule Item Code","type":"text"},{"apiName":"MSN_Service_Product_Code__c","guid":"column-cb3c","editable":false,"hasCustomHeaderLabel":true,"customHeaderLabel":"SPC","wrapText":true,"order":2,"label":"Service Product Code","type":"text"},{"apiName":"MSN_WorkPlan_Name__c","guid":"column-cb68","editable":false,"hasCustomHeaderLabel":false,"customHeaderLabel":"","wrapText":true,"order":3,"label":"Work Plan Name","type":"customRichText"},{"apiName":"MSN_RelatedAssetName__c","guid":"column-8b70","editable":false,"hasCustomHeaderLabel":true,"customHeaderLabel":"Asset","wrapText":true,"order":4,"label":"Related Asset","type":"customRichText"},{"apiName":"MSN_SF_WO_Reference__c","guid":"column-cdb0","editable":false,"hasCustomHeaderLabel":true,"customHeaderLabel":"Related to","wrapText":true,"order":5,"label":"SF Work Order Reference","type":"customRichText"}]

fields.name: Screen_ReviewSIC_ActionRadiobuttons_Heading
fields.fieldText: 2. What would you like to do?

fields.name: Screen_ReviewSIC_ActionRadiobuttons_Infotext
fields.fieldText: Please note: if you want to update a Schedule Item Code, please select one from the list above first and then choose the radio button option "Update the selected Schedule Item Code" and hit next.

fields.name: Screen_ReviewSIC_ActionRadiobuttons
fields.fieldText: Please select an action

screens.description: This screen is used as an error screen in case the system was not able to update the Status of the Work Order triggering this flow.
screens.name: Screen_Unanswered_WorkSteps_Error
screens.label: Unanswered Work Steps - Error

fields.name: Screen_Unanswered_WorkSteps_Error_Subheading
fields.fieldText: Wait! It looks like there are still some unanswered Work Steps for Observations and/or Schedule Items.

fields.name: Screen_Unanswered_WorkSteps_Error_Details
fields.fieldText:
Unfortunately, we cannot take you to the final review screen just yet. It looks like there might still be unanswered "Observations" or "Schedule Item Codes" (=Work Steps) for this Work Order or its Work Order Line Items. Please start over and check:


  • All Schedule Items have a SIC Code selected and are in the status "completed". You can check and amend these on the first overview screen of this flow.
  • All Observations (aka SPOTs) have been answered and are in the status "completed". You can do this from the "Review Observations" screen in this flow


Please use the button below to start over and review these items again.

screens.description: This screen is used as an error screen in case the system was not able to update the selected Service Appointment.
screens.name: Screen_Update_ServiceAppointment_Error
screens.label: Update Service Appointment - Error

fields.name: Screen_Update_ServiceAppointment_Error_Subheading
fields.fieldText: Awww, snap! I could not update the actual time values on the Service Appointment {!Screen_ReviewLabour_ServiceAppointmentDataTable.firstSelectedRow.AppointmentNumber}.

fields.name: Screen_Update_ServiceAppointment_Error_Details
fields.fieldText:
Unfortunately, the flow could not update the new actual time values you entered on the previous screen on the selected Service Appointment record. If you see this screen, it might be that:


  • You don't have the required access rights to update the Service Appointment Record
  • The Service Appointment has been updated by another user in the meantime too

Please get in touch with your friendly MSN Salesforce Support Team and inform them about this error.


You can close this dialogue now.

screens.description: This screen is used as an error screen in case the system was not able to update the Status of the Work Order triggering this flow.
screens.name: Screen_Update_WorkOrder_Status_Error
screens.label: Update Work Order Status - Error

value.stringValue: Error: Cannot update Work Order Status

fields.name: Screen_Update_WorkOrder_Status_Error_Subheading
fields.fieldText: Awww, snap! I could not update the status of the Work Order {!Get_Current_WorkOrder_Details.WorkOrderNumber}.

fields.name: Screen_Update_WorkOrder_Status_Error_Details
fields.fieldText:
Unfortunately, the flow could not update the status of the Work Order to "Reviewed". If you see this screen, it might be that:


  • You don't have the required access rights to update the Work Order Record
  • At least one related WOLI under this Work Order does not have the field "EAM Work Order Number" populated
  • A "Start" or "End Date" is missing on the Work Order.
  • The Work Order Status has been updated by another user in the meantime to a "completed" state and cannot be set back.

Please get in touch with your friendly MSN Salesforce Support Team and inform them about this error.


You can close this dialogue now.

screens.description: This screen is used to show the user a last summary screen in order for them to confirm the review for a last time before the Child Work Order is then set to the status "Reviewed" - that kicks off other automation and integration calls that cannot be reverted.
screens.name: Screen_WorkCompletedReview_Summary_ChildWO
screens.label: Work Completed Review - Summary (Child WO)

fields.name: Screen_WorkCompletedReview_Summary_ChildWO_Subheading
fields.fieldText: Please confirm Work Completed Review for {!Get_Current_WorkOrder_Details.WorkOrderNumber}

fields.name: Screen_WorkCompletedReview_Summary_ChildWO_Subheader
fields.fieldText: Well Done! You are about to finish your review, however, we need your confirmation. When you submit this screen, the process will:

fields.name: Screen_WorkCompletedReview_Summary_ChildWO_FieldComplete_Heading
fields.fieldText: 1. Send "Field Complete" request to EAM

fields.name: Screen_WorkCompletedReview_Summary_ChildWO_FieldComplete_InfoText
fields.fieldText: Please note: this includes "Observations" (SPOTS) and Work Order Completed Dates. Parts are immediately consumed and sent as soon as they are added by the field crew or you. The Child Work Order will be set to the status "Completed" automatically.

fields.name: Screen_WorkCompletedReview_Summary_ChildWO_SICDataTable_Heading
fields.fieldText: 2. Send the following Schedule Items to EAM

value.stringValue: [{"apiName":"MSN_WorkStep_Answer__c","guid":"column-91d5","editable":false,"hasCustomHeaderLabel":true,"customHeaderLabel":"SIC Description","wrapText":true,"order":0,"label":"Work Step Answer","type":"text"},{"apiName":"MSN_ScheduleItem_Code__c","guid":"column-e0c2","editable":false,"hasCustomHeaderLabel":true,"customHeaderLabel":"SIC","wrapText":true,"order":1,"label":"Schedule Item Code","type":"text"},{"apiName":"MSN_WorkPlan_Name__c","guid":"column-2d66","editable":false,"hasCustomHeaderLabel":true,"customHeaderLabel":"Work Plan","wrapText":true,"order":2,"label":"Work Plan Name","type":"customRichText"},{"apiName":"MSN_RelatedAssetName__c","guid":"column-8530","editable":false,"hasCustomHeaderLabel":true,"customHeaderLabel":"Asset","wrapText":true,"order":3,"label":"Related Asset","type":"customRichText"},{"apiName":"MSN_SF_WO_Reference__c","guid":"column-be84","editable":false,"hasCustomHeaderLabel":true,"customHeaderLabel":"Related to","wrapText":true,"order":4,"label":"SF Work Order Reference","type":"customRichText"}]

fields.name: Screen_WorkCompletedReview_Summary_ChildWO_ServiceResourceDataTable_H
fields.fieldText: 3. Send Labour for the following Field Crew to EAM

fields.name: Screen_WorkCompletedReview_Summary_ChildWO_ServiceResourceDataTable_I
fields.fieldText:
Please note: Labour Lines are only created for internal MSN field crew, not for subcontractors.


This work order is assigned to: {!Get_Current_WorkOrder_Details.MSN_ServiceTerritory_Name__c}

fields.name: Screen_WorkCompletedReview_Summary_ChildWO_Infotext
fields.fieldText:
Important Note:


After hitting "Finish", you CANNOT:

  • Adjust Service Appointments or add Labour Lines (if the work was assigned to internal MSN crew)


You still CAN DO:

  • A Work Complete Review for any additional, ancillary Child Work Orders (e.g. to add parts, adjust labor, check SICs)
  • Add additional Ancillary Child Work Orders

fields.name: Screen_WorkCompletedReview_Summary_ChildWO_ActionSubheading
fields.fieldText: 5. What would you like to do?

fields.name: Screen_WorkCompletedReview_Summary_ChildWO_ActionRadiobuttons
fields.fieldText: Please select an action

screens.description: This screen is used to show the user a last summary screen in order for them to confirm the review for a last time before the Work Order is then set to the status "Reviewed" - that kicks off other automation and integration calls that cannot be reverted.
screens.name: Screen_WorkCompletedReview_Summary_ParentWO
screens.label: Work Completed Review - Summary (Parent WO)

fields.name: Screen_WorkCompletedReview_Summary_ParentWO_Subheading
fields.fieldText: Please confirm Work Completed Review for {!Get_Current_WorkOrder_Details.WorkOrderNumber}

fields.name: Screen_WorkCompletedReview_Summary_ParentWO_Subheader
fields.fieldText: Well Done! You are about to finish your review, however, we need your confirmation. When you submit this screen, the process will:

fields.name: Screen_WorkCompletedReview_Summary_ParentWO_FieldComplete_Heading
fields.fieldText: 1. Send "Field Complete" request for the following WOLIs to EAM

fields.name: Screen_WorkCompletedReview_Summary_ParentWO_FieldComplete_InfoText
fields.fieldText:
Please note:

  • This includes "Observations" (SPOTS) and Work Order Completed Dates.
  • Parts are immediately consumed and sent as soon as they are added by the field crew or you.
  • The Parent Work Order will be set to the status "Reviewed", all "WOLIs" are set to the status "Completed"

value.stringValue: [{"apiName":"LineItemNumber","guid":"column-e81b","editable":false,"hasCustomHeaderLabel":true,"customHeaderLabel":"WOLI Number","wrapText":true,"order":0,"label":"Work Order Line Item Number","type":"text"},{"apiName":"MSN_WorkType_ActivityCode_Name__c","guid":"column-b231","editable":false,"hasCustomHeaderLabel":true,"customHeaderLabel":"Work Type","wrapText":true,"order":1,"label":"Work Type - Activity Code Name","type":"customRichText"},{"apiName":"MSN_AssetName__c","guid":"column-2d54","editable":false,"hasCustomHeaderLabel":true,"customHeaderLabel":"Asset","wrapText":true,"order":2,"label":"Asset Name","type":"customRichText"},{"apiName":"Status","guid":"column-c0c2","editable":false,"hasCustomHeaderLabel":true,"customHeaderLabel":"Current Status","wrapText":true,"order":3,"label":"Status","type":"text"},{"apiName":"MSN_EAM_Work_Order_No__c","guid":"column-a7fc","editable":false,"hasCustomHeaderLabel":true,"customHeaderLabel":"EAM WO Number","wrapText":true,"order":4,"label":"EAM Work Order Number","type":"text"}]

fields.name: Screen_WorkCompletedReview_Summary_ParentWO_SICDataTable_Heading
fields.fieldText: 2. Send the following Schedule Items to EAM

value.stringValue: [{"apiName":"MSN_WorkStep_Answer__c","guid":"column-91d5","editable":false,"hasCustomHeaderLabel":true,"customHeaderLabel":"SIC Description","wrapText":true,"order":0,"label":"Work Step Answer","type":"text"},{"apiName":"MSN_ScheduleItem_Code__c","guid":"column-e0c2","editable":false,"hasCustomHeaderLabel":true,"customHeaderLabel":"SIC","wrapText":true,"order":1,"label":"Schedule Item Code","type":"text"},{"apiName":"MSN_WorkPlan_Name__c","guid":"column-2d66","editable":false,"hasCustomHeaderLabel":true,"customHeaderLabel":"Work Plan","wrapText":true,"order":2,"label":"Work Plan Name","type":"customRichText"},{"apiName":"MSN_RelatedAssetName__c","guid":"column-8530","editable":false,"hasCustomHeaderLabel":true,"customHeaderLabel":"Asset","wrapText":true,"order":3,"label":"Related Asset","type":"customRichText"},{"apiName":"MSN_SF_WO_Reference__c","guid":"column-be84","editable":false,"hasCustomHeaderLabel":true,"customHeaderLabel":"Related to","wrapText":true,"order":4,"label":"SF Work Order Reference","type":"customRichText"}]

fields.name: Screen_WorkCompletedReview_Summary_ParentWO_ServiceResourceDataTable_Heading
fields.fieldText: 3. Send Labour for the following Field Crew to EAM

fields.name: Screen_WorkCompletedReview_Summary_ParentWO_ServiceResourceDataTable_InfoMSN
fields.fieldText: Please note: if multiple WOLIs exist under this Work Order, then the labour lines are going to be split equally across all WOLIs.

fields.name: Screen_WorkCompletedReview_Summary_ParentWO_ServiceResourceDataTable_InfoSub
fields.fieldText:
Please note: Labour Lines are only created for internal MSN field crew, not for subcontractors.


This work order is assigned to: {!Get_Current_WorkOrder_Details.MSN_ServiceTerritory_Name__c}

fields.name: Screen_WorkCompletedReview_Summary_ParentWO_Infotext
fields.fieldText:
Important Note:


After hitting "Finish", you CANNOT:

  • Add additional Assets (WOLIs) under this Work Order
  • Adjust Service Appointments or add Labour Lines


You still CAN DO:

  • A Work Complete Review for any additional, ancillary Child Work Orders (e.g. to add parts, adjust labor, check SICs)
  • Add additional Ancillary Child Work Orders

fields.name: Screen_WorkCompletedReview_Summary_ParentWO_ActionSubheading
fields.fieldText: 5. What would you like to do?

fields.name: Screen_WorkCompletedReview_Summary_ParentWO_ActionRadiobuttons
fields.fieldText: Please select an action

screens.description: This screen is used as an error screen in case the fields "Start Date" or "End Date" of the Work Order triggering this flow are empty.
screens.name: Screen_WorkOrder_StartEndDate_Error
screens.label: Error - Work Order Start or End Date fields blank

fields.name: Screen_WorkOrder_StartEndDate_Error_Subheading
fields.fieldText: Wait! It looks like the Work Order {!Get_Current_WorkOrder_Details.WorkOrderNumber} does not have a "Start-" or "Completed Date" populated.

fields.name: Screen_WorkOrder_StartEndDate_Error_Details
fields.fieldText:
Unfortunately, we cannot take you to the final review screen just yet. It looks like the Work Order record you are reviewing does not have both fields "Start Date" and "Completed Date" populated. This is required in order to send it successfully to EAM.


Please populate or update the required values for "Start Date" and "Completed Date" below and then hit the "Update Work Order" button.

fields.name: Screen_WorkOrder_StartEndDate_Error_StartDate
fields.fieldText: Work Order "Start Date"

fields.name: Screen_WorkOrder_StartEndDate_Error_EndDate
fields.fieldText: Work Order "Completed Date"

screens.description: This screen is used to let the user create additional Job Notes against the Work Order.
screens.name: Screen_WorkOrder_Status_NotAllowed
screens.label: Work Order Status Not Allowed

value.stringValue: Error: Work Order Status not allowed

fields.name: Screen_WorkOrder_StatusNotAllowed_ErrorSubheading
fields.fieldText: Awww, snap! Your Work Order {!Get_Current_WorkOrder_Details.WorkOrderNumber} is in a not allowed status "{!Get_Current_WorkOrder_Details.Status}".

fields.name: Screen_WorkOrder_StatusNotAllowed_ErrorDetails
fields.fieldText:
In order to do a "Work Completed Review", your work order must be in the status of "Ready for Review". If you see this screen, it might be that:


  • Open Service Appointments still exist under this Work Order. If the work is assigned to a Subcontractor not in Salesforce, please complete the Service Appointment manually.
  • Your work Order is already in a "Completed" state (Status "Reviewed", "Completed" or "Cancelled")

If you are doing this Review for the first time, please make sure, that all Service Appointments are either in the status "Completed" or "Cannot complete" first. Also check that your Work Order is not already Reviewed or Completed.


You can close this dialogue now.

screens.description: This Screen is only used in case the triggering Work Order is a "Child Work Order" and shows the user only details about the Work Order itself (but not e.g. Work Order Line Items which cannot exist)
screens.name: Screen_WorkOrderOverview_Child
screens.label: Work Order Overview - Child

fields.fieldText: Please note: Why don't you see the section "Work done on assets" (WOLI) or "Ancillary Work Orders"? Child Work Orders cannot have Work Order Line Items or additional "Grand Child Work Orders" as of restrictions in EAM.

fields.fieldText: 1. Schedule items selected (SIC)

subflows.description: Open the subflow "MSN - Add Additional Schedule Item Code - Desktop" in order to add an additional Schedule Item to the job. Please note: this functionality is derived from the features that a mobile field crew can choose from in the "work done" flow.
subflows.name: Subflow_Add_Additional_Schedule_Item
subflows.label: Subflow - Add Additional Schedule Item

subflows.description: Launch the subflow "MSN - Products Consumed - Add additional Parts - Screen Flow" in order to enable the users to either add or adjust parts related to the Work Order they are reviewing.
subflows.name: Subflow_AddAdditionalParts
subflows.label: Launch "Add Additional Parts" Subflow

subflows.name: Subflow_AddAssetToWorkOrder
subflows.label: Subflow - Add Asset to Work Order

subflows.description: Open the subflow "MSN - Work Steps- Complete All Open Work Steps - Desktop" in order to make adjustments to the selected "Work Step" record
subflows.name: Subflow_CompleteAllOpenWorkSteps
subflows.label: Subflow - Complete All Open Work Steps

subflows.description: Open the subflow "MSN - Work Steps- Complete All Open Work Steps - Desktop" in order to make adjustments to the selected "Work Step" record
subflows.name: Subflow_CompleteOpenWorkSteps_SIC
subflows.label: Subflow - Complete Open Work Steps - SIC

variables.description: This variable is populated automatically when the flow is openend from the Work Order triggering the flow and holds the record Id.
variables.name: recordId

variables.description: This record collection variable will hold all selected "Products Consumed" single record variables before creation of the records in the last step of the flow.
variables.name: var_ProductConsumed_RecordCollection

variables.description: This record variable is used to store record details of the part that has been chosen by the user to be consumed. This will then get assigned to a record collection variable prior to creation.
variables.name: var_ProductConsumed_SingleRecord

variables.description: Used to store the count of the "Get all Work Order Line Items" element. This is used on the Screen "Review Labour" in order to show the user how the labour lines are going to be split across multiple WOLIs.
variables.name: var_WorkOrderLineItemCount

variables.description: This Variable is used to manually assign the selected Collection from the Work Steps Data Table into this record table in order to loop over it.
variables.name: var_WorkSteps_RecordCollection

variables.description: This variable is used to loop over the selected Work Steps record from the Work Steps Data table.
variables.name: var_WorkSteps_SingleRecord
